intro: Hibbertia corifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and serrated leaves. The plant produces yellow-orange flowers with five petals, typically blooming in spring. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Hibbertia corifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
